meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes something impure or dirty.
meanings.sent1: The defiler left trash all over the beautiful park.
meanings.sent2: The defiler of the river was caught dumping chemicals into the water.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was the defiler of the picnic area, scattering food everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist was seen as a defiler of public property, leaving marks on walls.
meanings.sent5: The defiler of nature, the oil spill, caused harm to many animals.

meanings.definition: To make something impure or dirty.
meanings.sent1: Please do not defiler the clean room with your muddy shoes.
meanings.sent2: The factory's waste defilers the nearby stream, polluting the water.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to defiler the freshly washed car with mud.
meanings.sent4: His lies defiler the truth, making it hard to distinguish fact from fiction.
meanings.sent5: The vandalism defilers the beauty of the historic building, tarnishing its appearance.
